clusters.title: Talks between Russia and US on Ukraine were useful but work remains, says Putin aide
clusters.neutral_headline: Putin Meets with US Envoy on Ukraine, Discusses War

items.title: Talks between Russia and US on Ukraine were useful but work remains, says Putin aide
items.standfirst: Russian president holds meeting with Donald Trump’s envoy Steve Witkoff in Moscow
items.content: Russian president holds meeting with Donald Trump’s envoy Steve Witkoff in Moscow

items.title: Russia ‘ready’ for war with Europe, Putin says, as US peace talks end without progress
items.standfirst: Kremlin aide says Ukraine crisis is no closer to resolution after Witkoff talks, as Russian president accuses European powers of sabotaging peace Russia and the US did not make progress toward a peace deal for Ukraine during their talks, a senior aide to Vladimir Putin has said, hours after the Russian president issued threats that Russia was ready for war with Europe.In remarks to Russian media, Kremlin aide Yuri Ushakov said that after a five-hour meeting with Trump envoy Steve Witkoff and Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner, the two sides were “neither further nor closer to resolving the crisis in Ukraine. There is a lot of work to be done.” Continue reading...
items.content: Kremlin aide says Ukraine crisis is no closer to resolution after Witkoff talks, as Russian president accuses European powers of sabotaging peace Russia and the US did not make progress toward a peace deal for Ukraine during their talks, a senior aide to Vladimir Putin has said, hours after the Russian president issued threats that Russia was ready for war with Europe.In remarks to Russian media, Kremlin aide Yuri Ushakov said that after a five-hour meeting with Trump envoy Steve Witkoff and Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner, the two sides were “neither further nor closer to resolving the crisis in Ukraine. There is a lot of work to be done.” Continue reading...

items.title: Retired Marine colonel says there's "fundamental disconnect" between Russia, Ukraine amid U.S. talks
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted U.S. envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner at the Kremlin on Tuesday for a new round of talks to end the war in Ukraine. Ret. Marine Col. Mark Cancian joins "The Takeout" with his perspective on the negotiations.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted U.S. envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner at the Kremlin on Tuesday for a new round of talks to end the war in Ukraine. Ret. Marine Col. Mark Cancian joins "The Takeout" with his perspective on the negotiations.

items.title: Putin meets with Witkoff, Kushner to discuss Ukraine peace plan
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with US envoy Steve Witkoff to discuss the Ukraine peace effort.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with US envoy Steve Witkoff to discuss the Ukraine peace effort.

items.title: U.S. envoy Steve Witkoff meets with Putin in Moscow
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner met with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss the proposed Ukraine peace deal. Witkoff and Kushner arrived in the Russian capital fresh from talks with Ukraine in Florida this weekend, which both Washington and Kyiv deemed productive, without sharing details.
items.content: President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner met with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss the proposed Ukraine peace deal. Witkoff and Kushner arrived in the Russian capital fresh from talks with Ukraine in Florida this weekend, which both Washington and Kyiv deemed productive, without sharing details.

items.title: Putin and US negotiators hold high-stakes Ukraine talks in Moscow
items.standfirst: Top US negotiators vying to end the war in Ukraine met with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday in high-stakes talks happening as Moscow pressed battlefield advances. Putin, who received US President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner and special envoy Steve Witkoff in the Kremlin, signalled earlier that his forces were ready to fight on to achieve Russia's initial war goals. FRANCE 24's Antonia Kerrigan reports.
items.content: Top US negotiators vying to end the war in Ukraine met with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday in high-stakes talks happening as Moscow pressed battlefield advances. Putin, who received US President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner and special envoy Steve Witkoff in the Kremlin, signalled earlier that his forces were ready to fight on to achieve Russia's initial war goals. FRANCE 24's Antonia Kerrigan reports.

items.title: If Europe wants war with Russia, 'we are ready': Putin
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Tuesday that Russia was "ready" for war if Europe seeks one, accusing Europe of trying to sabotage a deal on the Ukraine conflict before he met with US envoys. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said Tuesday that Russia was "ready" for war if Europe seeks one, accusing Europe of trying to sabotage a deal on the Ukraine conflict before he met with US envoys. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.

items.title: Back to the Kremlin: Will Witkoff plan seal Ukraine's fate?
items.standfirst: A peace plan allegedly made in Moscow, a week of furious scrambling to dial it back by Ukraine and its European allies and now it's back to the Kremlin for Donald Trump's envoy Steve Witkoff, flanked only by the U-S president's son-in-law Jared Kushner and an interpreter. Have negotiations in Florida moved the needle back in Kyiv's favor? How hard - or soft - can the bargaining be?
items.content: A peace plan allegedly made in Moscow, a week of furious scrambling to dial it back by Ukraine and its European allies and now it's back to the Kremlin for Donald Trump's envoy Steve Witkoff, flanked only by the U-S president's son-in-law Jared Kushner and an interpreter. Have negotiations in Florida moved the needle back in Kyiv's favor? How hard - or soft - can the bargaining be?

items.title: Putin welcomes Witkoff and Kushner for Ukraine peace talks
items.standfirst: President Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff, and his son-in-law Jared Kushner, met with Russian President Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin in an attempt to make progress towards peace in Ukraine.
items.content: President Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff, and his son-in-law Jared Kushner, met with Russian President Vladimir Putin at the Kremlin in an attempt to make progress towards peace in Ukraine.

items.title: Putin shows little sign of compromise as he meets U.S. for Ukraine talks

items.content: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, President Donald Trump representatives tasked with negotiating an end to the war in Ukraine, will face Russian President Putin.

items.title: US envoy Witkoff concludes talks with Putin at the Kremlin on Ukraine war
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with US special envoy Steve Witkoff on Tuesday at the Kremlin for almost five hours of talks seeking to bring an end to the war in Ukraine, with a Russian envoy calling the discussions "productive".
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin met with US special envoy Steve Witkoff on Tuesday at the Kremlin for almost five hours of talks seeking to bring an end to the war in Ukraine, with a Russian envoy calling the discussions "productive".

items.title: U.S. envoy in Moscow for high-stakes Ukraine peace talks with Putin
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump’s special envoy is meeting Russian President Vladimir Putin Tuesday fortalks that Washington hopes will convince the Kremlin to end his war in Ukraine.
items.content: President Donald Trump’s special envoy is meeting Russian President Vladimir Putin Tuesday fortalks that Washington hopes will convince the Kremlin to end his war in Ukraine.

items.title: Ukraine warns 'tough issues' remain in peace talks as U.S. team heads to Russia
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump says there's a “good chance” for a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine, but his negotiators have hard work ahead — they now head to the Kremlin and still need to iron out key details with Kyiv
items.content: President Donald Trump says there's a “good chance” for a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine, but his negotiators have hard work ahead — they now head to the Kremlin and still need to iron out key details with Kyiv

ai_summary: Vladimir Putin met with US envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner in Moscow for talks.
The meeting lasted five hours, but no progress was made on resolving the Ukraine crisis.
Putin threatened strikes on ships, indicating readiness for potential conflict.
A retired Marine colonel noted a fundamental disconnect between Russia and Ukraine.
Discussions included the possibility of Marco Rubio ending the war in Ukraine.

items.title: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried praises Trump’s pardon of ex-Honduran president as he seeks clemency

items.content: SBF took to social media again on Tuesday to react to Trump's pardoning of former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández.

items.title: Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández freed after Trump pardon
Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández freed after Trump pardon
items.standfirst: Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández, sentenced last year to 45 years in prison for his role in a drug trafficking operation that moved hundreds of tons of cocaine to the United States, was released from prison following a pardon from President Donald Trump, officials confirmed Tuesday. FRANCE 24's Vedika Bahl reports.
items.content: Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández, sentenced last year to 45 years in prison for his role in a drug trafficking operation that moved hundreds of tons of cocaine to the United States, was released from prison following a pardon from President Donald Trump, officials confirmed Tuesday. FRANCE 24's Vedika Bahl reports.

items.title: What is Honduras ex-president accused of and why has Trump pardoned him?
items.standfirst: Juan Orlando Hernández, once called the key figure in a drug trafficking scheme that flooded America with over 400 tonnes of cocaine, walks free after the pardon.
items.content: Juan Orlando Hernández, once called the key figure in a drug trafficking scheme that flooded America with over 400 tonnes of cocaine, walks free after the pardon.

items.title: Trump frees ex-Honduran president from prison as country awaits knife-edge election result
items.standfirst: Release of convicted cocaine trafficker Juan Orlando Hernández is latest US interference in election and comes despite Trump’s apparent ‘war on drugs’Analysis: Trump’s pardon of Honduras’s ex-president shows counter-drug effort is ‘based on lies and hypocrisy’A former president of Honduras who was convicted of drug trafficking has walked free from a US prison after receiving a pardon from Donald Trump, as the country’s presidential election remained on a knife edge with the US-backed candidate leading by 515 votes.Juan Orlando Hernández, who was sentenced to 45 years in prison for allegedly creating “a cocaine superhighway to the United States”, was released from a West Virginia prison after Trump’s intervention, Hernández’s wife confirmed on Tuesday. Continue reading...
items.content: Release of convicted cocaine trafficker Juan Orlando Hernández is latest US interference in election and comes despite Trump’s apparent ‘war on drugs’Analysis: Trump’s pardon of Honduras’s ex-president shows counter-drug effort is ‘based on lies and hypocrisy’A former president of Honduras who was convicted of drug trafficking has walked free from a US prison after receiving a pardon from Donald Trump, as the country’s presidential election remained on a knife edge with the US-backed candidate leading by 515 votes.Juan Orlando Hernández, who was sentenced to 45 years in prison for allegedly creating “a cocaine superhighway to the United States”, was released from a West Virginia prison after Trump’s intervention, Hernández’s wife confirmed on Tuesday. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump pardons Honduran ex-president who was convicted of drug crimes
items.standfirst: President Trump has officially pardoned former Honduran President who US officials said was at the center of one of the largest and most violent drug-trafficking conspiracies in the world.
items.content: President Trump has officially pardoned former Honduran President who US officials said was at the center of one of the largest and most violent drug-trafficking conspiracies in the world.(Image credit: Marlon Gomez/CON)

items.title: Juan Orlando Hernandez freed after Trump’s ‘full and complete’ pardon
items.standfirst: US President Trump defends the pardon, calling Hernandez's treatment 'harsh' and backing his political ally's party.
items.content: US President Trump defends the pardon, calling Hernandez's treatment 'harsh' and backing his political ally's party.

items.title: Trump pardons ex-Honduras president convicted of drug trafficking
items.standfirst: President Trump has pardoned the former president of Honduras, Juan Orlando Hernández, who was convicted on drug trafficking and weapons charges in 2024 and sentenced to 45 years in prison. NBC News’ George Solis reports on Trump's decision, which comes at a pivotal time for Honduras amid its own presidential election.
items.content: President Trump has pardoned the former president of Honduras, Juan Orlando Hernández, who was convicted on drug trafficking and weapons charges in 2024 and sentenced to 45 years in prison. NBC News’ George Solis reports on Trump's decision, which comes at a pivotal time for Honduras amid its own presidential election.

ai_summary: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández was freed after a Trump pardon.
Hernández was sentenced to 45 years for drug trafficking to the United States.
The pardon occurred despite Trump's apparent "war on drugs" stance.
Sam Bankman-Fried praised Trump's pardon of the former Honduran president.
The release happened as Honduras awaited a close election result.

clusters.title: Former EU top diplomat Mogherini held in fraud probe
clusters.neutral_headline: Former EU Diplomat Mogherini Detained in Fraud Probe

items.title: Former EU top diplomat Mogherini held in fraud probe
items.standfirst: The EU's former foreign policy chief Federica Mogherini was taken into custody Tuesday as police staged raids probing suspected fraud over contracts to train future European diplomats. Mogherini, who was high representative for foreign affairs from 2014 to 2019, now leads the College of Europe graduate school whose premises were searched along with the offices of the EEAS diplomatic service.
items.content: The EU's former foreign policy chief Federica Mogherini was taken into custody Tuesday as police staged raids probing suspected fraud over contracts to train future European diplomats. Mogherini, who was high representative for foreign affairs from 2014 to 2019, now leads the College of Europe graduate school whose premises were searched along with the offices of the EEAS diplomatic service.

items.title: Former EU foreign policy chief Mogherini detained in fraud probe
items.standfirst: The European Union's former top diplomat, Federica Mogherini, was taken into custody on Tuesday as “part of a probe into suspected fraud related to EU-funded training for junior diplomats”, according to a statement by the bloc's independent public prosecutor's office.
items.content: The European Union's former top diplomat, Federica Mogherini, was taken into custody on Tuesday as “part of a probe into suspected fraud related to EU-funded training for junior diplomats”, according to a statement by the bloc's independent public prosecutor's office.

items.title: Ex-EU top diplomat Mogherini detained in Belgium fraud case: Reports
items.standfirst: Mogherini is reported to be among three in custody for suspected fraud involving an EU-funded training programme.
items.content: Mogherini is reported to be among three in custody for suspected fraud involving an EU-funded training programme.

items.title: Former EU top diplomat among three held in fraud investigation
items.standfirst: Belgian police raid EU foreign service HQ and College of Europe and arrest Federica Mogherini and two othersBelgian police have arrested three people including the EU’s former top diplomat Federica Mogherini and raided the headquarters of the EU foreign service and the elite College of Europe as part of an investigation into suspected fraud.The three were detained “as part of a probe into suspected fraud related to EU-funded training for junior diplomats”, the European public prosecutor’s office said in a statement, without naming individuals. Continue reading...
items.content: Belgian police raid EU foreign service HQ and College of Europe and arrest Federica Mogherini and two othersBelgian police have arrested three people including the EU’s former top diplomat Federica Mogherini and raided the headquarters of the EU foreign service and the elite College of Europe as part of an investigation into suspected fraud.The three were detained “as part of a probe into suspected fraud related to EU-funded training for junior diplomats”, the European public prosecutor’s office said in a statement, without naming individuals. Continue reading...

items.title: Police detain Federica Mogherini in EU fraud probe

items.content: EU’s former diplomatic chief and top Brussels official in custody over suspicions of wrongdoing in contract award

ai_summary: Federica Mogherini, former EU foreign policy chief, was detained.
The detention is part of a probe into suspected fraud.
The fraud relates to EU-funded training for junior diplomats.
Belgian police raided the EU foreign service HQ and College of Europe.
Three people, including Mogherini, are in custody.

items.title: Michael Dell 'Super Excited' to See Kids' Accounts Grow
items.standfirst: Dell CEO Michael Dell explains why he and Susan Dell are giving 25 million American children $250 each to jumpstart an investment account for their futures. The $6.25 billion gift builds on the Invest America initiative, better known as “Trump accounts," created earlier this year as part of President Donald Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill Act. He speaks on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

He speaks on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

The donation is for children aged 10 and younger.

clusters.title: Publisher condemns Hegseth's use of Franklin the Turtle in boat strike meme
clusters.neutral_headline: Publisher Condemns Hegseth's Use of "Franklin the Turtle

items.title: Publisher condemns Hegseth's use of Franklin the Turtle in boat strike meme
items.standfirst: The Canadian publishing house behind the "Franklin" children's books appeared to condemn Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth, after he posted a cartoon image of the turtle blowing up a boat.
items.content: The Canadian publishing house behind the "Franklin" children's books appeared to condemn Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth, after he posted a cartoon image of the turtle blowing up a boat.

items.title: Book publisher condemns Pete Hegseth's fake Franklin the Turtle cover
items.standfirst: The Canadian publisher behind the popular "Franklin" books has responded to Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's social media post with a fake book title, "Franklin Targets Narco Terrorists." The publisher, Kids Can Press, said in part, "We strongly condemn any denigrating, violent, or unauthorized use of Franklin's name or image, which directly contradicts these values."
items.content: The Canadian publisher behind the popular "Franklin" books has responded to Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's social media post with a fake book title, "Franklin Targets Narco Terrorists." The publisher, Kids Can Press, said in part, "We strongly condemn any denigrating, violent, or unauthorized use of Franklin's name or image, which directly contradicts these values."

items.title: 'Franklin' publisher slams Hegseth for his post of the turtle firing on drug boats
items.standfirst: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth faces growing scrutiny over an attack on an alleged drug boat. His response included a parody of the kids' book character Franklin, showing the turtle firing at boats.
items.content: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth faces growing scrutiny over an attack on an alleged drug boat. His response included a parody of the kids' book character Franklin, showing the turtle firing at boats.(Image credit: Felix Leon)

items.title: Publisher condemns ‘violent’ use of Franklin the Turtle after Hegseth’s boat strike post
items.standfirst: US defense secretary posted meme depicting beloved children’s character aiming rocket launcher at set of boatsPete Hegseth told US soldiers in Iraq to ignore legal advice on rules of engagementA post on social media by US defense secretary Pete Hegseth, depicting a beloved children’s character aiming a rocket launcher at a cluster of boats, has elicited condemnation from the book’s Canadian publisher.Hegseth’s post of the mocked cover of a Franklin the Turtle book titled Franklin Targets Narco Terrorists prompted disbelief and outrage. The image shows a smiling anthropomorphic turtle in military helmet and vest, with a US flag on his arm and a drug-laden boat exploding in the background. “For your Christmas wish list,” Hegseth wrote as the caption. Continue reading...
items.content: US defense secretary posted meme depicting beloved children’s character aiming rocket launcher at set of boatsPete Hegseth told US soldiers in Iraq to ignore legal advice on rules of engagementA post on social media by US defense secretary Pete Hegseth, depicting a beloved children’s character aiming a rocket launcher at a cluster of boats, has elicited condemnation from the book’s Canadian publisher.Hegseth’s post of the mocked cover of a Franklin the Turtle book titled Franklin Targets Narco Terrorists prompted disbelief and outrage. The image shows a smiling anthropomorphic turtle in military helmet and vest, with a US flag on his arm and a drug-laden boat exploding in the background. “For your Christmas wish list,” Hegseth wrote as the caption. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The publisher of "Franklin the Turtle" condemned Hegseth's social media post.
Hegseth posted a parody image of Franklin targeting boats.
The publisher stated it strongly condemns the unauthorized use of the image.
The post drew criticism for its violent and denigrating content.
The publisher's statement directly contradicts the values of the book.

items.title: 'We will never get justice,' say Hillsborough families as report finds fundamental police failures
items.standfirst: A report finds 12 ex-police officers would have faced gross misconduct cases over the disaster under today's laws.
items.content: A report finds 12 ex-police officers would have faced gross misconduct cases over the disaster under today's laws.

items.title: Hillsborough families decry ‘bitter injustice’ that no officers will face disciplinary proceedings
items.standfirst: None of the former officers named by the IOPC will face disciplinary proceedings because they have all retiredTimeline: decades seeking justice and changeThe families of those who died in the 1989 Hillsborough disaster have said it is a “bitter injustice” that no police officer will ever be held accountable for a catalogue of failings set out in the final report of the police watchdog after a 14-year investigation.The Independent Office for Police Conduct (IOPC) found that 12 police officers, most of them senior, would have faced disciplinary cases of gross misconduct if they were still serving. Continue reading...
items.content: None of the former officers named by the IOPC will face disciplinary proceedings because they have all retiredTimeline: decades seeking justice and changeThe families of those who died in the 1989 Hillsborough disaster have said it is a “bitter injustice” that no police officer will ever be held accountable for a catalogue of failings set out in the final report of the police watchdog after a 14-year investigation.The Independent Office for Police Conduct (IOPC) found that 12 police officers, most of them senior, would have faced disciplinary cases of gross misconduct if they were still serving. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A report found widespread police failings in the Hillsborough disaster.
Families of victims say they will never get justice.
The report found 12 ex-police officers would have faced misconduct charges.
No officers will face disciplinary proceedings due to retirement.
The families view this as a bitter injustice.

items.title: Trump officials threaten to withhold Snap funds from Democratic-led states
items.standfirst: Agriculture secretary Brooke Rollins threatens to pull funds unless states turn over recipient data to US governmentThe Trump administration has threatened to suspend Snap food assistance to several Democratic-led states unless they turn over recipient data to the federal government.The agriculture secretary, Brooke Rollins, said on Tuesday that the USDA could begin blocking funds as early as next week if Democratic-led states continue to reject federal requests for Snap recipient data – information that includes immigration status and social security numbers. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Eric Trump’s cryptocurrency firm loses half its value in half an hour
items.standfirst: American Bitcoin Corp’s shares fell from $2.39 to $1.90 after closing in what some are calling ‘crypto winter’Shares in Eric Trump’s crypto mining business lost more than half their value in less than 30 minutes on Tuesday.The nosedive of American Bitcoin Corp, which triggered repeated trading halts, followed the steep decline of many cryptocurrencies and crypto-linked companies into what some observers are calling the onset of a “crypto winter”. Bitcoin’s value has fallen sharply since the start of October and erased a year of large gains. Continue reading...
items.content: American Bitcoin Corp’s shares fell from $2.39 to $1.90 after closing in what some are calling ‘crypto winter’Shares in Eric Trump’s crypto mining business lost more than half their value in less than 30 minutes on Tuesday.The nosedive of American Bitcoin Corp, which triggered repeated trading halts, followed the steep decline of many cryptocurrencies and crypto-linked companies into what some observers are calling the onset of a “crypto winter”. Bitcoin’s value has fallen sharply since the start of October and erased a year of large gains. Continue reading...

items.content: Shares of American Bitcoin wiped out more than half of their value in less than 30 minutes on Tuesday. This is amid sharp pullback in Bitcoin prices over the past month. Bloomberg's Monique Mulima discussed it on "Bloomberg Markets" with Katie Greifeld. (Source: Bloomberg)

The district is one Trump carried by 22 points.
Both Democrats and Republicans are spending heavily.
Polls show the Democratic candidate within striking distance.

clusters.title: Quarter of police forces lack basic policies on sexual offences, Sarah Everard inquiry finds
clusters.neutral_headline: Quarter of Police Forces Lack Sexual Offenses Policies

items.title: Quarter of police forces lack basic policies on sexual offences, Sarah Everard inquiry finds
items.standfirst: The report, four years after the 33-year-old's murder, says urgent action is needed to prevent violent, sexual attacks against women.
items.content: The report, four years after the 33-year-old's murder, says urgent action is needed to prevent violent, sexual attacks against women.

items.title: Quarter of police forces missing basic policies on sexual offences, says Sarah Everard report
items.standfirst: Official report says forces in England and Wales yet to implement recommendations for investigationsA quarter of police forces in England and Wales are yet to implement “basic policies for investigating sexual offences”, an official report has found, with women still being failed despite promises of change after the murder of Sarah Everard four years ago.The report by Dame Elish Angiolini follows an inquiry set up after Everard was murdered by a serving police officer, Wayne Couzens, in March 2021. She was abducted off a London street while walking home. Continue reading...
items.content: Official report says forces in England and Wales yet to implement recommendations for investigationsA quarter of police forces in England and Wales are yet to implement “basic policies for investigating sexual offences”, an official report has found, with women still being failed despite promises of change after the murder of Sarah Everard four years ago.The report by Dame Elish Angiolini follows an inquiry set up after Everard was murdered by a serving police officer, Wayne Couzens, in March 2021. She was abducted off a London street while walking home. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A report found a quarter of police forces lack basic policies.
The policies are for investigating sexual offenses.
The report is from the Sarah Everard inquiry.
The report says urgent action is needed.
The report was released four years after Everard's murder.

clusters.title: UK government delays decision on China’s super-embassy until January
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Delays Decision on China's Super-Embassy

items.title: UK government delays decision on China’s super-embassy until January
items.standfirst: New date to approve site near Tower Bridge in London aligns with Keir Starmer’s planned visit to BeijingThe government has delayed its decision on whether to approve China’s super-embassy in London until January, when Keir Starmer is expected to visit Beijing.Ministers are expected to greenlight the controversial plans after formal submissions by the Home Office and Foreign Office raised no objections on security grounds. Continue reading...
items.content: New date to approve site near Tower Bridge in London aligns with Keir Starmer’s planned visit to BeijingThe government has delayed its decision on whether to approve China’s super-embassy in London until January, when Keir Starmer is expected to visit Beijing.Ministers are expected to greenlight the controversial plans after formal submissions by the Home Office and Foreign Office raised no objections on security grounds. Continue reading...

items.title: Government delays Chinese 'super embassy' decision
items.standfirst: The UK government has again delayed its decision over whether to approve a Chinese "super embassy" in London until January.
items.content: The UK government has again delayed its decision over whether to approve a Chinese "super embassy" in London until January.

ai_summary: The UK government delayed a decision on China's super-embassy.
The decision is delayed until January.
Keir Starmer is expected to visit Beijing in January.
The Home Office and Foreign Office raised no security objections.
Ministers are expected to approve the plans.

items.title: Imran Khan healthy but isolated in jail, his sister says

items.content: Imran Khan is suffering from isolation, his sister said, after weeks of not being able to see his family.

Khan's sister visited him and reported on his condition.
Khan is reportedly very angry about his isolation.
Khan has been unable to see his family for weeks.
Khan is a former Prime Minister of Pakistan.

clusters.title: Pope prays at Beirut port blast site on last day of Lebanon visit
clusters.neutral_headline: Pope prays at Beirut port blast site on last day of Lebanon visit

items.title: Pope prays at Beirut port blast site on last day of Lebanon visit
items.standfirst: Pope Leo XIV demanded justice for the more than 200 victims of the disaster, at the end of his three-day visit to Lebanon.
items.content: Pope Leo XIV demanded justice for the more than 200 victims of the disaster, at the end of his three-day visit to Lebanon.

items.title: Pope Leo wraps up his visit to Lebanon with prayers at the site of Beirut's port blast
items.standfirst: Pope Leo XIV ended his first overseas papal trip with prayers at Beirut's devastated port and a Mass attended by 150,000 worshippers in a country desperate for signs of hope amid fear of renewed war.
items.content: Pope Leo XIV ended his first overseas papal trip with prayers at Beirut's devastated port and a Mass attended by 150,000 worshippers in a country desperate for signs of hope amid fear of renewed war.(Image credit: Adri Salido)

ai_summary: Pope Leo XIV prayed at the Beirut port blast site.
The prayer was on the last day of his Lebanon visit.
The Pope demanded justice for the victims.
The disaster killed more than 200 people.
The Pope's visit was his first overseas trip.

clusters.title: Death toll from Indonesia floods passes 700 as 1 million evacuated

items.title: Death toll from Indonesia floods passes 700 as 1 million evacuated
items.standfirst: About 3.2 million people on Sumatra island have been affected, 2,600 have been injured and 504 are missingThe number of people killed by floods and landslides on Indonesia’s Sumatra island rose to 708 on Tuesday, the country’s disaster agency said, with 504 people missing.The toll was a sharp increase from the 604 dead reported by the agency on Monday. Continue reading...
items.content: About 3.2 million people on Sumatra island have been affected, 2,600 have been injured and 504 are missingThe number of people killed by floods and landslides on Indonesia’s Sumatra island rose to 708 on Tuesday, the country’s disaster agency said, with 504 people missing.The toll was a sharp increase from the 604 dead reported by the agency on Monday. items.title: Death toll in Indonesia floods passes 600
items.standfirst: Another 500 people are missing, while thousands more have been injured after a cyclone hit the region.
items.content: Another 500 people are missing, while thousands more have been injured after a cyclone hit the region.

ai_summary: The death toll from Indonesia floods passed 700.
Over 1 million people have been evacuated.
2,600 people have been injured.
504 people are still missing.
The floods and landslides occurred on Sumatra island.
